homepage.features.browserMemo.descriptio.message: A lightweight memo function usable only in the browser.

homepage.features.diary.description.message: Daily records and personal miscellaneous notes.

homepage.features.exams.description.message: Study notes and reviews for certification exams.

homepage.features.links.description.message: A collection of reference links useful for development and learning.

homepage.features.news.description.message: A list of sites useful for daily information gathering.

homepage.features.tech.description.message: Organizing daily learnings and blog posts.

links.page.description.message: A collection of useful links to technical documents and tools for development and learning.

news.page.description.message: A curated list of news sites to help you keep up with domestic and international affairs and technology trends.

page.browser-memo.alert.restoreFailed.message: Failed to restore memos. The link may be corrupted.

page.browser-memo.alert.urlTooLongConfir.message:
The generated URL is very long and may not work in some environments. Do you want to continue?
(We recommend using a URL shortening service.)

page.browser-memo.confirm.clearAll.message: Are you sure you want to clear all memos? This action cannot be undone.

page.browser-memo.confirm.restoreAll.message: Do you want to restore the shared memos? Your current memos will be overwritten.

page.browser-memo.description.message: A high-performance browser notepad that's ready to use without login or installation. Features Markdown preview and easy sharing via URL. Your data is saved only in your browser, providing a secure and private note-taking environment.

page.browser-memo.faq.q1.message: What format can I write notes in?

page.browser-memo.faq.q4.message: Is backing up my data necessary?

page.browser-memo.intro.message: A high-performance yet simple browser notepad that's ready to use instantly. It supports Markdown preview and URL sharing. All your input is automatically saved only in your browser, ensuring your privacy and security.

page.browser-memo.notes.backup.message: This is a lightweight tool. It is strongly recommended that you back up any important data separately.

page.browser-memo.notes.markdown.message: Notes support Markdown format. You can toggle the display with the preview button.

page.browser-memo.notes.storage.message: Your notes are automatically saved when you pause typing or when the text area loses focus.

page.browser-memo.notes.urlLengthWarning.message: If your notes are very long, the generated shareable URL will also be very long. We recommend using a URL shortening service when sharing.

page.browser-memo.preview.empty.message: There is no content to preview.

page.browser-memo.title.message: Advanced Browser Notepad - Markdown, URL Sharing, No Installation Required

theme.admonition.warning.description: The default label used for the Warning admonition (:::warning)

theme.blog.archive.title.description: The page & hero title of the blog archive page

theme.blog.author.noPosts.description: The text for authors with 0 blog post

theme.blog.paginator.olderEntries.description: The label used to navigate to the older blog posts page (next page)

theme.blog.post.readMoreLabel.description: The ARIA label for the link to full blog posts from excerpts

theme.blog.tagTitle.description: The title of the page for a blog tag

theme.CodeBlock.copyButtonAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for copy code blocks button

theme.CodeBlock.copied.description: The copied button label on code blocks

theme.CodeBlock.wordWrapToggle.description: The title attribute for toggle word wrapping button of code block lines

theme.common.skipToMainContent.description: The skip to content label used for accessibility, allowing to rapidly navigate to main content with keyboard tab/enter navigation

theme.contentVisibility.draftBanner.mess.message: This page is a draft. It will only be visible in dev and be excluded from the production build.

theme.contentVisibility.unlistedBanner.m.message: This page is unlisted. Search engines will not index it, and only users having a direct link can access it.

theme.docs.breadcrumbs.navAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for the breadcrumbs

theme.docs.paginator.next.description: The label used to navigate to the next doc

theme.docs.paginator.previous.description: The label used to navigate to the previous doc

theme.docs.sidebar.collapseButtonTitle.description: The title attribute for collapse button of doc sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.closeSidebarButtonAri.description: The ARIA label for close button of mobile sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.expandButtonAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label and title attribute for expand button of doc sidebar

theme.docs.sidebar.navAriaLabel.description: The ARIA label for the sidebar navigation

theme.docs.sidebar.toggleSidebarButtonAr.description: The ARIA label for hamburger menu button of mobile navigation

theme.DocSidebarItem.expandCategoryAriaL.description: The ARIA label to expand the sidebar category

theme.ErrorPageContent.title.description: The title of the fallback page when the page crashed

theme.ErrorPageContent.tryAgain.description: The label of the button to try again rendering when the React error boundary captures an error

theme.lastUpdated.byUser.description: The words used to describe by who the page has been last updated

theme.navbar.mobileVersionsDropdown.labe.description: The label for the navbar versions dropdown on mobile view

theme.NotFound.p1.description: The first paragraph of the 404 page

theme.NotFound.p2.message: Please contact the owner of the site that linked you to the original URL and let them know their link is broken.

theme.SearchModal.footer.selectText.description: The explanatory text of the action for the enter key

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.removeFavo.description: The label for remove favorite search button

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.removeRece.description: The label for remove recent search button

theme.SearchModal.startScreen.saveRecent.description: The label for save recent search button

news.majorCategory.international.description: Major category title for International news sites

news.majorCategory.japan.description: Major category title for Japanese news sites

news.category.audio-podcast-int.description: Category title for international audio and podcasts

news.category.general-economy-int.description: Category title for international general and economy news

news.category.general-economy-jp.description: Category title for Japanese general and economy news

news.category.life-weather-jp.description: Category title for Japanese life and weather news

news.category.press-release-jp.description: Category title for Japanese press release sites

news.category.security-jp.description: Category title for Japanese security and IT professional news

news.category.summary-sites-int.description: Category title for international news aggregators and journalism

news.category.summary-sites-jp.description: Category title for Japanese news aggregators

news.category.tech-science-int.description: Category title for international technology and science news

news.category.tech-science-jp.description: Category title for Japanese technology and science news

news.category.tv-news-jp.description: Category title for Japanese TV news sites

news.site.int.ap.bbc.desc.message: The international broadcasting arm of the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), established in 1932. It delivers news and documentaries to the world in over 40 languages via radio, online, and podcasts.

news.site.int.ap.cnn.desc.message: Audio content such as news and documentaries provided by CNN.

news.site.int.ap.economist.desc.message: In-depth political and economic analysis podcasts from The Economist magazine.

news.site.int.ap.npr.desc.message: A weekend news and information program from National Public Radio (NPR) in the United States.

news.site.int.ap.sed.desc.message: A podcast and blog offering daily news, interviews, and discussions on software engineering.

news.site.int.ge.afp.desc.message: A French news agency, successor to an organization founded in 1835 by Charles-Louis Havas. It is the world's oldest news agency and has a strong focus on visual reporting, including photos and videos.

news.site.int.ge.aljazeera.desc.message: Established in 1996 with funding from the government of Qatar and operated by the Al Jazeera Media Network. An international news organization that broadcasts global news from a Middle Eastern and Arab world perspective, distinct from Western media.

news.site.int.ge.ap.desc.message: A non-profit cooperative news agency founded in 1846 by five New York City newspapers. Known for its speed and objectivity, it distributes articles to media worldwide.

news.site.int.ge.bi.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 2007 by Henry Blodget and operated by Axel Springer SE. It delivers business and technology news with high speed and has multiple international editions worldwide.

news.site.int.ge.bloomberg.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1981 by Michael Bloomberg. A leading global economic and financial media company, with the Bloomberg Terminal financial data and analysis tool at its core.

news.site.int.ge.chinadaily.desc.message: The only English-language daily newspaper published by the Communist Party of China. It communicates China's official views and developments.

news.site.int.ge.digiday.desc.message: An international edition of a specialized media that delves into the transformation of digital media, marketing, advertising, and retail.

news.site.int.ge.dw.desc.message: Germany's international public broadcaster, established in 1953. Although funded by the German federal government, its editorial independence is legally guaranteed. It broadcasts news from a German and European perspective in over 30 languages.

news.site.int.ge.fox.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1996 by Rupert Murdoch and operated by Fox News Media. Known for its conservative perspective, it is a cable news network with high viewership in the United States.

news.site.int.ge.kyivindependent.desc.message: An independent English-language news media in Ukraine, founded in 2021 by former journalists of the Kyiv Post. It is internationally known for its coverage of the Russian invasion of Ukraine and focuses on investigative reporting.

news.site.int.ge.lemonde.desc.message: The English edition of France's leading newspaper, founded in 1944 by Hubert Beuve-Méry. It is renowned for its detailed analysis of international affairs and high-quality investigative journalism.

news.site.int.ge.nikkei.desc.message: Launched in 2013 by Nikkei Inc. It reports on Asian business, economy, and politics in English from the perspective of a Japanese media outlet. Known for its specialized coverage of Asia.

news.site.int.ge.reuters.desc.message: Founded in the UK in 1851 by Paul Julius Reuter and operated by Thomson Reuters. A global news agency known for its fact-based, impartial, and prompt reporting, with operations in over 190 countries.

news.site.int.ge.rt.desc.message: An international news channel established in 2005 with funding from the Russian government. Operated by ANO TV-Novosti, it reports international news in multiple languages from a Russian perspective.

news.site.int.ge.sputnik.desc.message: Established in 2014 by the Russian government as part of a restructuring of state news agencies. Operated by the state media group 'Rossiya Segodnya,' it broadcasts news and radio in over 30 languages, conveying Russia's official views.

news.site.int.ge.wsj.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1889 by Charles Dow and others. Operated by Dow Jones & Company, a subsidiary of News Corp. It is characterized by high-quality investigative reporting in the business and financial sectors.
news.site.int.ge.wsj.desc.description: Description for The Wall Street Journal

news.site.int.ge.wsj.title.description: Title for The Wall Street Journal

news.site.int.ge.xinhua.desc.message: China's state news agency, established in 1931. It is China's largest and official news organization, distributing the official views and news of the Communist Party of China domestically and internationally in multiple languages.

news.site.int.ss.alltop.desc.message: A news aggregator that compiles top news and blog posts on various topics.

news.site.int.ss.bellingcat.desc.message: An independent investigative journalism group founded in 2014 by Eliot Higgins. Known for its methods of investigating and analyzing conflicts and crimes using open-source intelligence (OSINT). Registered as a non-profit foundation in the Netherlands.

news.site.int.ss.ground.desc.message: Founded in Canada in 2017 by former NASA engineers including Harleen Kaur. A platform that visualizes the political bias (left, center, right) of various media outlets on a single news story, enabling multi-faceted information comparison.

news.site.int.ss.icij.desc.message: A non-profit investigative reporting organization founded in the U.S. in 1997 by Charles Lewis. Known for the 'Panama Papers' and 'Pandora Papers,' it pursues wrongdoing through cross-border collaboration.

news.site.int.ss.intercept.desc.message: Founded in 2014 by Glenn Greenwald and others, operated by First Look Media. Sparked by the reporting on the Edward Snowden documents, it advocates for confrontational journalism on issues like national surveillance, war, and human rights.

news.site.int.ss.marshall.desc.message: A non-profit news organization founded in the U.S. in 2014 by Neil Barsky. It focuses specifically on the U.S. criminal justice system, aiming to raise public awareness of its inequalities.

news.site.int.ss.newsnow.desc.message: A news aggregator that compiles the latest headlines from news sources worldwide in real-time.

news.site.int.ss.occrp.desc.message: Founded in 2006 by Drew Sullivan and Paul Radu. An international non-profit network of investigative journalists specializing in organized crime and corruption. It pursues cross-border crime in collaboration with media outlets worldwide.

news.site.int.ss.propublica.desc.message: A non-profit investigative journalism organization founded in the U.S. in 2007 by Paul Steiger. With a mission to expose abuses of power and betrayals of public trust, it is funded by the Sandler Foundation and has won numerous Pulitzer Prizes.

news.site.int.ts.geekwire.desc.message: Reports on technology, startups, and innovation, with a focus on Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.

news.site.int.ts.mit.desc.message: Founded and operated by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) since 1899. One of the world's most authoritative technology magazines, analyzing the commercial, political, and social impacts of emerging technologies.

news.site.int.ts.sciencedaily.desc.message: Daily news that delivers the latest scientific research press releases.

news.site.int.ts.scitech.desc.message: A media outlet that provides a wide range of the latest research and news in the fields of science and technology.

news.site.int.ts.techcrunch.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 2005 by Michael Arrington and operated by Yahoo Inc. A leading media outlet reporting on startups and the technology industry, it hosts the large-scale conference 'Disrupt.'

news.site.int.ts.wired.desc.message: Founded in the U.S. in 1993 by Louis Rossetto and others, operated by Condé Nast. A media outlet that has influenced the world with its style of deeply exploring the impact of technology on culture, economy, and politics, and contemplating the future.

news.site.jp.ge.47news.desc.message: Established in 2006. Operated by Zenkoku Shimbun NET Co., Ltd. Kyodo News and 52 local newspapers from across the country participate, providing news from both central and regional perspectives.

news.site.jp.ge.bi.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the economic media founded in the U.S. in 2007 by Henry Blodget, operated by Mediagene Inc. It primarily targets millennials and delivers news on business, finance, and technology.

news.site.jp.ge.bloomberg.desc.message: The Japanese version of Bloomberg L.P., founded in the U.S. in 1981 by Michael Bloomberg. Its core business is the financial information terminal 'Bloomberg Terminal,' and it has a significant influence on finance and the economy.

news.site.jp.ge.minkabu.desc.message: Founded in 2006 by Ken Uryu. Operated by MINKABU THE INFONOID, Inc. It provides unique content specialized in financial information for individual investors, such as stock price forecasts using AI and cloud input.

news.site.jp.ge.nikkei.desc.message: Founded in 1876 by Takashi Masuda (founder of Mitsui & Co.). Operated by Nikkei Inc. Known for its specialized economic reporting and is the source of the Nikkei Stock Average. Acquired the Financial Times in 2015.

news.site.jp.ge.reuters.desc.message: The Japanese version of the international news agency founded in the UK in 1851 by Paul Julius Reuter. Operated by Thomson Reuters, it is one of the world's top three news agencies with a fast and global reporting network.

news.site.jp.ge.sekaikabuka.desc.message: A site specialized in displaying market data for major global stock indices, currencies, commodity futures, and cryptocurrencies at a glance.

news.site.jp.ge.yahoo.desc.message: Service launched in 1996. Operated by LINE Yahoo Corporation. Originating from Yahoo! Inc., founded by Jerry Yang and others. Japan's largest news aggregator, distributing news from numerous content providers.

news.site.jp.lw.tenki.desc.message: Official weather forecast media of the Japan Weather Association. Also provides extensive disaster prevention information.

news.site.jp.lw.yahoo.desc.message: Weather forecasts and disaster information provided by Yahoo! Japan.

news.site.jp.pr.kyodo.desc.message: A press release distribution service operated by Kyodo News. Provides reliable corporate information.
news.site.jp.pr.kyodo.desc.description: Description for Kyodo News PR Wire

news.site.jp.pr.kyodo.title.description: Title for Kyodo News PR Wire

news.site.jp.pr.prtimes.desc.message: One of Japan's largest press release distribution services. Get the latest corporate information quickly.

news.site.jp.sec.ipa.desc.message: A public organization under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, established in 2004. It supports Japan's national IT strategy from a technical standpoint and is responsible for publishing the '10 Major Security Threats' and conducting the Information Technology Engineers Examination.

news.site.jp.sec.secnext.desc.message: Launched in 2004. A professional news site for cybersecurity and personal information protection operated by News Gaia Inc. It promptly reports on incidents and vulnerabilities.

news.site.jp.ss.ceek.desc.message: A news search engine that allows cross-searching of major domestic news.

news.site.jp.ts.ascii.desc.message: A web media originating from 'Monthly ASCII,' founded in 1977 by Kazuhiko Nishi. Operated by KADOKAWA ASCII Research Laboratories, Inc. It has a history since the dawn of personal computers in Japan and provides timely news on PCs, IT, and gadgets.

news.site.jp.ts.cnet.desc.message: The Japanese version of the technology news site founded in the U.S. in 1994 by Halsey Minor and others. Operated by Asahi Interactive, Inc. It has a strong focus on IT product reviews and information on corporate solutions.

news.site.jp.ts.gigazine.desc.message: Launched in 2000 by Keito Yamazaki and operated by OSA Inc. Known for its in-depth articles based on unique perspectives and detailed reporting. It covers a wide range of topics from gadget reviews to science and food culture.

news.site.jp.ts.mit.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the world's oldest technology magazine, founded in 1899 by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). Operated by KADOKAWA ASCII Research Laboratories, Inc. It analyzes the social and economic impact of new technologies.
news.site.jp.ts.mit.desc.description: Description for MIT Technology Review Japan

news.site.jp.ts.mit.title.description: Title for MIT Technology Review Japan

news.site.jp.ts.wired.desc.message: The Japanese edition of the technology culture magazine founded in the U.S. in 1993 by Louis Rossetto and others. Operated by Condé Nast Japan, it is known for exploring the impact of technology on culture, society, and lifestyle with future-oriented insights.

news.site.jp.tv.asahi.desc.message: The news site of TV Asahi. Disseminates information from a unique perspective.

news.site.jp.tv.fuji.desc.message: News distribution site by the news division of Fuji Television.

news.site.jp.tv.nhk.desc.message: The comprehensive news site of the Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK). Provides a wide range of domestic and international news.

news.site.jp.tv.ntv.desc.message: The news site of Nippon Television. Provides timely news.

news.site.jp.tv.tbs.desc.message: The news site of TBS Television. Reports in detail on current events and social issues.

news.site.jp.tv.tx.desc.message: A specialized economic and business news site from TV Tokyo.

links.majorCategory.academicResearch.description: Category title for academic research links

links.majorCategory.cloudInfra.description: Category title for cloud and infrastructure links

links.majorCategory.documentation.description: Category title for documentation and diagramming tools

links.majorCategory.learningCommunity.description: Category title for learning and community links

links.majorCategory.versionControl.description: Category title for version control links

links.site.academic.acm.desc.message: Covers all journals and international conference proceedings published by the ACM, the largest academic society in computing.

links.site.academic.arxiv.desc.message: A pioneering open-access platform for free public access to pre-peer-reviewed papers in physics, mathematics, CS, etc.

links.site.academic.citeseerx.desc.message: A search engine that automatically extracts and links citation information for papers in the computer and information science fields.

links.site.academic.dblp.desc.message: A bibliographic information database specializing in CS, accurately tracking researchers' paper lists and co-author networks.

links.site.academic.doaj.desc.message: A directory that includes only high-quality, reliable open access journals that meet quality standards.

links.site.academic.ieee.desc.message: A digital library that provides academic journals, papers, and technical standards in electrical engineering and CS published by IEEE.

links.site.academic.medrxiv.desc.message: A preprint server specializing in medicine, clinical, and health sciences. Shares the latest research findings promptly.

links.site.academic.researchrabbit.desc.message: A literature survey tool that visually explores related papers to foster new discoveries. Also known as the 'Spotify for Papers.'

links.site.academic.scholar.desc.message: A search engine that allows cross-searching of papers and books in all academic fields and tracks citation counts.

links.site.academic.scispace.desc.message: A platform that uses AI to assist in searching, understanding, and writing research papers, contributing to the efficiency of literature reviews.

links.site.academic.semanticscholar.desc.message: Utilizes AI to support literature searches by automatically generating paper summaries and visualizing high-impact citations.

links.site.academic.ssrn.desc.message: One of the world's largest platforms for sharing working papers and preprints, primarily in the social sciences and humanities.

links.site.academic.techrxiv.desc.message: A preprint server for electrical engineering and CS fields, established by IEEE.

links.site.academic.elicit.desc.message: AI research assistant automates from paper search to summarization. Efficiently discover and analyze relevant papers for research questions.

links.site.academic.pubmed.desc.message: World's largest database for medical and life sciences literature. Search peer-reviewed papers including MEDLINE.

links.site.ai.kaggle.desc.message: The world's largest community for data science competitions, public datasets, and learning resources.

links.site.ai.kubeflow.desc.message: A platform for deploying and managing ML workflows on Kubernetes.

links.site.backend.django.desc.message: A Python framework for rapidly developing robust and scalable web applications.

links.site.backend.drf.desc.message: A toolkit for building powerful and flexible Web APIs with Django.

links.site.backend.fastapi.desc.message: A modern, fast web framework based on Python 3.6+ type hints.

links.site.backend.flask.desc.message: A lightweight and extensible Python micro web framework.

links.site.backend.nestjs.desc.message: A Node.js framework for building efficient and scalable server-side applications.

links.site.backend.node.desc.message: Official documentation for the asynchronous event-driven JavaScript runtime environment.

links.site.backend.openapi.desc.message: A standard specification for describing RESTful APIs. Rich ecosystem.

links.site.backend.python.desc.message: Official Python 3 documentation, from language specifications to the standard library.

links.site.cloud.docker.desc.message: The de facto standard for container virtualization technology. Official documentation.

links.site.cloud.gcb.desc.message: A managed service for running CI/CD pipelines on GCP.

links.site.cloud.gcp.desc.message: Complete GCP documentation, including quickstarts, tutorials, and comprehensive guides.

links.site.cloud.gcpArch.desc.message: The Cloud Architecture Center provides reference architectures, design guidance, and best practices.

links.site.cloud.ghactions.desc.message: A CI/CD platform integrated with GitHub. Automates workflows.

links.site.cloud.terraform.desc.message: Official documentation for the leading tool for achieving Infrastructure as Code.

links.site.data.bigquery.desc.message: A serverless data warehouse that can analyze petabytes of data.

links.site.data.dbt.desc.message: The 'T' in ELT tool that helps with data transformation in a data warehouse.

links.site.data.sqlzoo.desc.message: A site where you can learn SQL practically through interactive tutorials and exercises.

links.site.devtools.geeksforgeeks.desc.message: A site rich in articles, tutorials, and problems on computer science topics.

links.site.devtools.git.desc.message: Official documentation for the distributed version control system Git.

links.site.devtools.github.desc.message: Official documentation for GitHub features like code hosting, collaborative development, and Actions.

links.site.devtools.hackernews.desc.message: A tech news site run by Y Combinator. A place where geeky discussions from around the world gather.

links.site.devtools.learngit.desc.message: An excellent learning tool to learn Git branching operations visually and interactively.

links.site.devtools.leetcode.desc.message: A collection of algorithm and data structure problems, ideal for preparing for technical interviews.

links.site.devtools.roadmap.desc.message: Learning roadmaps for various technical fields for developers. Shows you what to learn next.

links.site.devtools.stackoverflow.desc.message: A Q&A community where developers from all over the world ask questions and share knowledge.

links.site.docs.docusaurus.desc.message: A static site generator built with React. Ideal for building documentation sites.

links.site.docs.mdx.desc.message: Format that enables JSX components within Markdown. Perfect for creating interactive documentation and blog posts.

links.site.docs.drawio.desc.message: A powerful free diagramming tool that can be used in the browser. Supports creating all kinds of diagrams, including flowcharts, UML, and network diagrams.

links.site.docs.excalidraw.desc.message: An online whiteboard for quickly creating hand-drawn style diagrams. Powerful collaborative editing features make it ideal for team brainstorming and design discussions.

links.site.docs.figma.desc.message: A collaborative platform for everything from UI design to chart creation. An online tool widely used in the engineering design process.

links.site.docs.markdown.desc.message: A comprehensive guide covering everything from the basics of Markdown syntax to extended features.

links.site.docs.mermaid.desc.message: A library for generating diagrams and charts from text like Markdown.

links.site.docs.obsidian.desc.message: A powerful knowledge base tool as a second brain, working on local Markdown files.

links.site.docs.plantuml.desc.message: A tool for quickly creating UML diagrams from a simple text description language.

links.site.frontend.caniuse.desc.message: An essential tool for checking the browser support status of front-end technologies.

links.site.frontend.mdn.desc.message: The de facto standard for web technologies. Official reference for HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

links.site.frontend.nextjs.desc.message: A production framework based on React. Offers a variety of rendering strategies.

links.site.frontend.playwright.desc.message: A framework for automating reliable end-to-end testing.

links.site.frontend.react.desc.message: A declarative JavaScript library for building component-based UIs.

links.site.frontend.tailwind.desc.message: A utility-first CSS framework. Quickly build custom designs within your HTML.

links.site.frontend.ts.desc.message: A superset of JavaScript that introduces static typing, enhancing the robustness of large-scale development.

links.site.frontend.vite.desc.message: A next-generation front-end tool featuring a fast development server and build.

links.site.frontend.webdev.desc.message: A collection of best practices for modern web development by Google. Performance, accessibility, etc.

links.site.security.awesomesec.desc.message: A curated list of tools, resources, libraries, etc., related to security.

links.site.security.cisa.desc.message: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency. Provides threat information and alerts.

links.site.security.hacksplaining.desc.message: A site where you can learn about security vulnerabilities through interactive lessons.

links.site.security.mitocw.desc.message: Provides free access to MIT lecture materials. Also rich in cybersecurity-related courses.

links.site.security.nist.desc.message: The U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology. Famous for its Cybersecurity Framework, etc.

links.site.security.owasp.desc.message: An open community aimed at improving the security of web applications.

links.site.security.portswigger.desc.message: A free online learning resource on web security vulnerabilities by PortSwigger.

links.site.security.securitynext.desc.message: A specialized media that provides the latest information on cybersecurity, incidents, vulnerabilities, and countermeasures.

links.site.standards.ietf.desc.message: A volunteer-based organization that develops technical standards for the Internet.

links.site.standards.w3c.desc.message: An international standards organization that develops technical standards for the World Wide Web.

news.site.jp.ss.googlenews.desc.message: A news aggregator provided by Google. It uses AI to consolidate information from news sources around the world and provides a personalized news feed tailored to the user's interests.

news.site.int.ss.googlenews.desc.message: The international (US) version of the news aggregator provided by Google. It utilizes AI to gather information from news sources worldwide, enabling information collection from a global perspective and personalization tailored to the user.

news.site.int.ts.techmeme.title.description: The title for Techmeme on the news page

news.site.int.ts.techmeme.desc.message: Founded in 2005 by Gabe Rivera. A highly influential aggregator that consolidates technology industry news using a combination of humans and algorithms.
news.site.int.ts.techmeme.desc.description: The description for Techmeme on the news page

links.site.learningCommunity.techmeme.ti.description: The title for Techmeme on the links page

links.site.learningCommunity.techmeme.de.message: Founded in 2005 by Gabe Rivera. A highly influential aggregator that consolidates technology industry news using a combination of humans and algorithms.
links.site.learningCommunity.techmeme.de.description: The description for Techmeme on the links page

links.site.frontend.jamstack.title.description: The title for Jamstack on the links page

links.site.frontend.jamstack.desc.message: A modern web architecture named after JavaScript, APIs, and Markup. It aims to improve performance, security, and scalability.
links.site.frontend.jamstack.desc.description: The description for Jamstack on the links page

links.site.cloud.netlify.title.description: The title for Netlify on the links page

links.site.cloud.netlify.desc.message: A platform that automates building, deploying, and hosting by linking with GitHub/GitLab. It is a core component of the Jamstack architecture.
links.site.cloud.netlify.desc.description: The description for Netlify on the links page

links.site.docs.decapcms.title.description: The title for Decap CMS on the links page

links.site.docs.decapcms.desc.message: An open-source headless CMS that uses a Git repository as its backend. It provides an intuitive UI for managing Markdown content and has high affinity with static site generators.
links.site.docs.decapcms.desc.description: The description for Decap CMS on the links page

homepage.features.aiTools.description.message: AI tools for development & productivity enhancement.

homepage.meta.description.message: This is a technical blog that compiles technical information and daily learnings. It also offers tools such as a browser-based notepad, a list of news sites, collections of links to technical resources and academic papers, and an AI tools collection.
homepage.meta.description.description: The meta description for the homepage

aiTools.page.description.message: A comprehensive collection of AI tools useful for development and productivity enhancement.

aiTools.tool.aiChat.chatgpt.desc.message: A versatile AI chatbot that excels at human-like text generation, answering complex questions, and supporting a wide range of writing and coding tasks.

aiTools.tool.aiChat.claude.desc.message: An AI assistant that excels at reading long texts and complex reasoning, emphasizing polite and safe dialogue. Capable of processing up to 200,000 tokens in a single session.

aiTools.tool.aiChat.gemini.desc.message: A multimodal AI deeply integrated with Google's services that can understand and process multiple data formats including text, code, and images.

aiTools.tool.aiChat.copilot.desc.message: An AI assistant capable of providing answers based on the latest web information and generating images. Enables seamless use in daily work through native integration with Windows and Office products.

aiTools.tool.programming.githubCopilot.d.message: An AI pair programmer that provides code completion, suggestions, and entire function creation within developers' editors. Trained on vast amounts of code from GitHub, enabling highly accurate contextual suggestions.

aiTools.tool.programming.tabnine.desc.message: An AI that learns team-specific code and coding conventions while prioritizing privacy to personalize code completion. Can run in local environments.

aiTools.tool.programming.cursor.desc.message: An AI-native code editor that enables code editing, refactoring, and debugging through natural language instructions.

aiTools.tool.programming.cody.desc.message: Code search and AI completion for large-scale repositories. Supports multiple LLM selection and can batch process codebases up to 1M tokens.

aiTools.tool.aiDev.aiStudio.desc.message: A tool for testing Google's latest AI models (Gemini family) in the browser and developing prototypes. Features powerful prompt-to-code generation capabilities.

aiTools.tool.aiDev.anthropicConsole.desc.message: A developer platform for testing Anthropic's AI models (Claude family) and using them via API. Features long-text processing capabilities and safety-focused models.

aiTools.tool.automation.n8n.desc.message: A tool for building complex multi-step automation workflows using a visual editor. Open source and can be run on your own servers.

aiTools.tool.automation.make.desc.message: An automation platform that allows visual workflow creation by connecting app icons through drag-and-drop. Enables intuitive creation of complex branching and loop processing.

aiTools.tool.automation.zapier.desc.message: An automation tool supporting over 7,000 app integrations. Features AI-powered workflow construction suggestions and serves as the standard tool for workflow automation.

aiTools.tool.research.perplexity.desc.message: An AI search engine that provides accurate answers with cited web sources in response to questions. Delivers reliable, source-backed responses in a conversational format.

aiTools.tool.research.notebookLM.desc.message: A Google-made AI research assistant that helps integrate information and discover insights based on user-uploaded materials.

aiTools.tool.research.tenbin.desc.message: A web tool that enables simultaneous comparison and evaluation of outputs from multiple major LLMs (GPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.) using the same prompt. Ideal for model selection and prompt tuning.

aiTools.tool.research.elicit.desc.message: An AI research assistant specialized in searching, summarizing, and analyzing research papers. Rich in features for efficiently extracting insights from vast academic literature.
